intro: Dorstenia dinklagei var. binzaensis, commonly known as the Zanzibar mountain star, is a unique member of the Dioscoreaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Tanzania, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
